Cloud Native IoT Device Management

Mini Project by CSE - Q Team 7, Anurag University

About the Project

This project showcases a modern, cloud-native solution for managing and monitoring Internet of Things (IoT) devices in real-time. Designed by the CSE - Q team of Anurag University, it demonstrates seamless integration between a device simulator, backend APIs, and an interactive web dashboard.

Team Contribution

As a dedicated student team, we focused on applying core concepts of cloud computing, microservices, and real-time communication protocols such as MQTT. This project not only reflects our technical capability, but also our ability to work collaboratively to solve real-world problems.

üîë Key Highlights That Make Our Project Stand Out:

  • üåê End-to-End Cloud-Native Architecture with Docker Support
  • üì° Real-Time IoT Device Simulation with MQTT
  • üìä Live Dashboard to Monitor Temperature & Humidity
  • üß† Modular, Scalable, and Production-Ready Codebase
  • üè´ Personalized for Anurag University ‚Äì Including academic relevance

Innovation & Learning

From container orchestration to live data streaming, our project incorporates modern DevOps and IoT practices to bridge the gap between academic theory and industry-standard application development.

Submitted by: CSE - Q Team 7, Anurag University
